input

Class Keyboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • input.Keyboard

  • public class Keyboard
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods for getting keyboard input
    Author:
    jafi2

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Keyboard.CharListener
      Class for listening to char input
      This input is already formated and does not contains any information on which modifier keys were used, but the char is effected by the modifier keys.
      static class  Keyboard.KeyListener
      Class for listening to raw Keyboard input

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(long window)
        Initializes the keyboard input
        this class should not be used without calling this method first
        Parameters:
        window - the id of the openGL window

      • isKeyDown

        public static boolean isKeyDown(int key,
                                int playerID)
        Is the given key down for the given player
        If the playerID equals Game.net.playerID the local input is check otherwise the input is received through network
        Parameters:
        key - GLFW.GLFW_KEY_Keyname
        playerID - the id of player who's input should be used
        Returns:
        is the key down?

      • destroy

        public static void destroy()
        Cleans up Keyboard listeners and releases callbacks

      • runOnKeyDown

        public static void runOnKeyDown(int keycode,
                                int modifiers,
                                int playerID)
        Runs the onKeyDown Event for the given player
        Parameters:
        keycode - GLFW code of the key
        modifiers - used modification keys (e.g. Crtl)
        playerID - id of the player

      • runOnKeyUp

        public static void runOnKeyUp(int keycode,
                              int modifiers,
                              int playerID)
        Runs the onKeyUp Event for the given player
        Parameters:
        keycode - GLFW code of the key
        modifiers - used modification keys (e.g. Crtl)
        playerID - id of the player

      • runOnKeyRepeat

        public static void runOnKeyRepeat(int keycode,
                                  int modifiers,

        Runs the onKeyRepeat Event for the given player
        Parameters:
        keycode - GLFW code of the key
        modifiers - used modification keys (e.g. Crtl)
        playerID - id of the player

      • runOnChar

        public static void runOnChar(char c,
                             int playerID)
        Runs the onChar Event for the given player
        Parameters:
        c - char typed
        playerID - id of the player

      • addKeyListener

        public static void addKeyListener(Keyboard.KeyListener kl,
                                  int playerID)
        Adds a key listener to the keyboard
        Parameters:
        kl - the key listener
        playerID - the id of the player who's input should be used

      • addCharListener

        public static void addCharListener(Keyboard.CharListener cl,
                                   int playerID)
        Adds a char listener to the keyboard
        Parameters:
        cl - the char listener
        playerID - the id of the player who's input should be used

      • removeKeyListener

        public static boolean removeKeyListener(Keyboard.KeyListener kl,
                                        int playerID)
        Removes the given key Listener from the keyboard
        Parameters:
        kl - the key listener to remove
        playerID - the id of the player who's listener should be removed
        Returns:
        did the listener get removed
        Also returns false if the key listener was not found

      • removeCharListener

        public static boolean removeCharListener(Keyboard.CharListener cl,
                                         int playerID)
        Removes the given char Listener from the keyboard
        Parameters:
        cl - the char listener
        playerID - the id of the player who's listener should be removed
        Returns:
        did the listener get removed
        Also returns false if the key listener was not found
